newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page - Nov 29.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page - Nov 29.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following stories on its front page on Friday:
- The United Nations intervention force in Zaire got rebels who control a region in the country to let it airdrop food to refugees.
- Algerians are set to approve a new authoritarian constitution.
- Senior Volkswagen executive Jose Ignacio Lopez is expected to resign after fighting charges that he stole secret documents from General Motors.
- Scientists have discovered that people prone to anxiety and pessimism have a slightly abbreviated version of a certain gene.
- The U.S. federal government has praised a small town near Chicago for reducing smoking among teenagers by imposing strict laws on the sale of tobacco to people who are under age.
- A provision in New York State's constitution could prevent the city of New York from spending billions of dollars on schools, bridges and other projects.
